item.title: England's X-factor has 'hill to climb' - will Palmer go to World Cup?
item.description: Does Cole Palmer still have hope of making England's World Cup squad? BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty examines the Chelsea star's chances.

item.title: Man City links '100% speculation', says Maresca
item.description: Reports suggesting Enzo Maresca is the potential successor to Pep Guardiola at Manchester City are "100% speculation", the Chelsea boss says.

item.title: 'Result is not what we wanted' - games pile up for Palace
item.description: The games are piling up for Crystal Palace who face a two-legged play-off in the Conference League after failing to qualify automatically for the last 16.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Zambian rapper Sampa the Great
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Zambian rapper Sampa the Great - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Nancy, Ayunga & Hearts v Rangers in spotlight
item.description: Will Wilfried Nancy end his losing start as Celtic manager? Will Jonah Ayunga continue his scoring streak? And how are Heart of Midlothian and Rangers shaping up for Sunday's Scottish Premiership game of the weekend?

item.title: Best player? Surprise package? Review of WSL so far
item.description: Former England internationals Ellen White and Fara Williams review the Women's Super League season so far as we head into a winter break.

item.title: All in on Ekitike? The FPL talking points
item.description: With Liverpool's attack looking thin, is it time to gamble on buying Reds striker Hugo Ekitike? Our FPL experts take a look.

item.title: Uefa pays £7.8m to clubs for Women's Euros players
item.description: Uefa has distributed €9 million (£7.88m) between 103 European clubs as benefit payments for releasing players for Women's Euro 2025, with Chelsea and Arsenal sharing £763,000

item.title: Spain to face Argentina in Finalissima - but what is it?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when and where the 2026 Finalissima is.

item.title: Agyemang is Young Sports Personality of the Year
item.description: England forward Michelle Agyemang is named BBC Young Sports Personality of the Year 2025.

item.title: 'Majestic strike' - Mead and Park feature in UWCL best goals
item.description: Strikes from Beth Mead and Jess Park feature in the best goals from this week's Uefa Women's Champions League.

item.title: 'There's a real excitement' - Ballard on Sunderland form and new signings
item.description: Sunderland's Dan Ballard discusses how excitement from fans has influenced their home form and the influence Granit Xhaka has had on the club.

item.title: Watch Celtic lose fourth game in row at Dundee Utd
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Celtic throw away a lead to lose 2-1 at Dundee United for a fourth defeat in a row.

item.title: Celebrity Arsenal fans send message to Lifetime Achievement winner Henry
item.description: Rob Beckett, Beth Mead and KSI are among the famous faces to send a message to former Arsenal and France footballer Thierry Henry, after his Lifetime Achievement award win at BBC Sports Personality of the Year.

item.title: What are Fifa's 'more affordable' World Cup tickets?
item.description: BBC Sport explains some details about the "more affordable" $60 (£45) tickets for the 2026 World Cup, introduced after criticism of Fifa's pricing structure for the tournament.

item.title: Unsung heroes and trailblazers - Rooney and Allardyce on management
item.description: Wayne Rooney and Sam Allardyce discuss management, club owners and rewarding staff at football clubs in the latest episode of The Wayne Rooney Show

item.title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
item.description: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

item.title: England boss Wiegman named Coach of the Year
item.description: England women's manager Sarina Wiegman is named the BBC Sports Personality Coach of the Year for a second time.

item.title: Man Utd plot Semenyo move in January - Friday's gossip
item.description: Manchester United target Antoine Semenyo in January transfer, Ruben Neves wants Premier League return, Bruno Fernandes' release clause revealed and Bukayo Saka on the verge of signing new Arsenal contract.

item.title: Xhaka 'lifted Sunderland standards' - Ballard
item.description: Dan Ballard says Granit Xhaka's arrival at Sunderland rose the standards at the club to help them compete in the top half of the Premier League.

item.title: Let Nancy 'cook' and judge at end of season - Henry
item.description: Thierry Henry urges Celtic's management and fans to give their new manager Wilfried Nancy more time, saying they must "let him cook" and judge him at the end of the season.

item.title: Henry honoured with Lifetime Achievement award
item.description: Thierry Henry is honoured with the Lifetime Achievement award at BBC Sports Personality of the Year on Thursday.

item.title: Fifty-nine injured in Colombia Cup final violence
item.description: 59 people are injured in a clash between rival fans at the Colombia Cup final between Atletico Nacional and Deportivo Independiente Medellin.

item.title: Salah seeks Afcon success with Egypt as Morocco eye home glory
item.description: Two of African football's biggest names, Achraf Hakimi and Mohamed Salah, are hoping to lead their nations to glory as the Africa Cup of Nations gets ready to kick off in Morocco.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: West Ham sack Skinner after one win in 11 games
item.description: West Ham sack head coach Rehanne Skinner after winning only one of their opening 11 Women's Super League games this season.

item.title: Target red-hot Ekitike and Semenyo - FPL team of the week
item.description: With Manchester City facing struggling West Ham at home this week, it's time to triple up on Pep Guardiola's side and captain Mr Reliable Erling Haaland.

item.title: Watch Man Utd and Bournemouth's eight-goal thriller
item.description: Bournemouth's Junior Kroupi scores the equaliser in a dramatic 4-4 draw against Manchester United at Old Trafford, after two quick-fire goals from United's Bruno Fernandes and Matheus Cunha put the hosts in front.

item.title: Rogers' 'brilliant strike' helps Villa keep pressure on top two
item.description: Aston Villa came from behind to win against West Ham, a Morgan Rogers beauty completing the comeback to keep up Villa's fine form.

item.title: More pressure piled on Frank as Forest outclass Spurs
item.description: Callum Hudson-Odoi and Ibrahim Sangare combine for three goals as Nottingham Forest outclass Tottenham at the City Ground.

item.title: Haaland scores twice as Man City win at Crystal Palace
item.description: Erling Haaland scores twice to help Manchester City dispatch Crystal Palace and maintain the pressure on Premier League leaders Arsenal.

item.title: Woltemade own goal gives Sunderland win over Newcastle
item.description: Nick Woltemade puts through his own net as Sunderland enjoy a derby win to remember against arch-rivals Newcastle United.

item.title: Best player? Favourite to win WSL? Emma Sanders Q&A
item.description: As women's domestic and European football takes a pause for the winter break, we asked football fans on Reddit for their questions for BBC Sport reporter Emma Sanders.

item.title: Worst start in Old Firm history - how does Celtic manager Nancy compare?
item.description: Wilfried Nancy is the first Old Firm boss to lose his opening four matches - can he recover Celtic's season and survive?

item.title: Spurs open to selling forward Johnson
item.description: Tottenham's Europa League final match-winner Brennan Johnson is facing an uncertain future at the club amid growing Premier League interest in the attacker.

item.title: Swansea v Wrexham - the 'derby' which catches the eye
item.description: Swansea City host Wrexham on Friday in a Championship fixture which is a big deal in Wales - and will also be watched from much further afield.

item.title: 'Keep the faith' urges Celtic boss Nancy after fourth defeat
item.description: Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy insists his side "did a good job" despite suffering a fourth defeat in a row at Dundee United.

item.title: Wales boss Bellamy's tactical masterclass
item.description: Wales head coach Craig Bellamy gives BBC viewers a unique insight into the way he sets up his side for crucial World Cup qualifiers.

item.title: Amorim 'really disappointed' to draw 'fun game'
item.description: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim says his team "lost two points" in a helter-skelter 4-4 Premier League draw against Bournemouth. United led three times but had to settle for a point.

item.title: A lot of positives for Bournemouth in draw - Iraola
item.description: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola says his team can take positives from their 4-4 draw at Manchester United, but that there are also "some things to correct" from the performance.

item.title: How 'influential' Rogers sets the tone for Aston Villa
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Theo Walcott and Joe Hart look at how "composed and confident" Morgan Rogers "set the tone" for Aston Villa in their 3-2 comeback win over West Ham.

item.title: Chelsea waiting for Arsenal in Champions League
item.description: Arsenal will set up an all-English quarter-final against Chelsea in the Women's Champions League if they beat Leuven in the play-offs.

item.title: Ex-Wolves striker Ebanks-Blake wins court battle against surgeon
item.description: Sylvan Ebanks-Blake said the surgeon failed to properly outline the risks associated with the procedure.

item.title: Ecuador defender Pineida killed in shooting
item.description: Ecuador defender Mario Pineida dies at the age of 33 after being shot outside a shop in Guayaquil.

item.title: 'Questions pile up at Celtic, but only some are for Nancy'
item.description: At this point, it's not just Wilfried Nancy's Celtic team that's a hard watch, it's Nancy himself, writes Tom English.

item.title: 'He cannot play left-back' - should Trafford 'stick it out' at Man City?
item.description: James Trafford is up against one of the best in the world in Gianluigi Donnarumma, but should he stick it out as number two at Manchester City?

item.title: Why are Premier League shirts so expensive?
item.description: The prices of football kits continue to rise - but how do the costs of an £85 Premier League shirt break down?

item.title: How Man City were able to beat a spirited Crystal Palace
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Theo Walcott and Joe Hart look at how Manchester City's backline were able to hold off Crystal Palace before Erling Haaland and Phil Foden went on to win the game at Selhurst Park.

item.title: How Dyche has Forest's forwards firing
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Theo Walcott and Joe Hart analyse how Sean Dyche has turned Nottingham Forest into a potent attacking side.

item.title: Farke delighted with 'unbelievable human' Calvert-Lewin
item.description: Leeds manager Daniel Farke praises goalscorer Dominic Calvert-Lewin after the striker rescues a point against Brentford at the Gtech Community Stadium.

item.title: 'Fair result' - Andrews on Brentford draw with Leeds
item.description: Brentford manager Keith Andrews says a point each was deserved after their 1-1 draw with Leeds at Gtech Community Stadium.

item.title: Performance and result a 'step backwards' - Frank
item.description: Tottenham boss Thomas Frank was disappointed with his side's "disjointed" display in their 3-0 loss to Nottingham Forest at the City Ground.

item.title: Wiegman first woman to be named Dutch coach of the year
item.description: England manager Sarina Wiegman becomes the first women to be named Dutch Coach of the Year at an annual awards ceremony in the Netherlands.

item.title: Are English clubs ready for Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Chelsea, Arsenal and Manchester United remain in the hunt for Women's Champions League glory - but how are they set for the knockout stages?

item.title: Newcastle to face Man City in EFL Cup semi-finals
item.description: Holders Newcastle United face eight-time winners Manchester City in the semi-finals of the Carabao Cup while Chelsea take on Arsenal or Crystal Palace.

item.title: Unlucky to miss out? Who makes the alternative World XI?
item.description: The Fifa Best Men's XI was announced on Tuesday in Qatar, but who was unfortunate to miss out? BBC Sport takes a look at an alternative World XI.

item.title: 'Nancy must go', but 'board are to blame' - Celtic fans react
item.description: After another turbulent day for Celtic ended with a fourth defeat in a row under new manager Wilfried Nancy, fans have been reacting angrily to the Frenchman's tenure and the club hierarchy.

item.title: How will Afcon impact Premier League teams?
item.description: Theo Walcott and Joe Hart discuss the impact that the upcoming Afcon will have on various clubs throughout the Premier League.

item.title: Emery believes in quality of superb Rogers
item.description: Unai Emery applauds his "maturing" Aston Villa side after Morgan Rogers scores twice in the second half as they came from 2-1 down to win at West Ham.

item.title: Chelsea back to winning ways with dominant win over Brighton
item.description: Chelsea end their four-game winless streak in the Women's Super League with a comfortable 3-0 away victory against Brighton.

item.title: Performance was better than FA Cup Final - Glasner
item.description: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner feels his side played better against Manchester City in their 3-0 loss at Selhurst Park than they did when they beat Pep Guardiola's team in the FA Cup final last season.

item.title: Guardiola praises 'fantastic' players after win over Palace
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola reflects on a big win over Crystal Palace as his side stay within two points of top-of-the-table Arsenal.

item.title: Inside Wales HQ: Bellamy's tactical masterclass
item.description: Craig Bellamy gives an insight into life as Wales head coach as he sits down with BBC Sport Wales' Feast of Football podcast.

item.title: Six players to watch at Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa picks out six players to keep an eye on at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco from 21 December to 18 January.

item.title: How Messi's GOAT tour of India hit trouble
item.description: From crowd violence on day one to meeting cricket royalty and kickabouts with kids - what happened on Lionel Messi's GOAT Tour of India.

item.title: BBC or ITV? Inside how World Cup broadcast picks are made
item.description: We now know the broadcast schedule for the 2026 World Cup, but how do BBC and ITV decide who shows which matches?

item.title: All you need to know about Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa provides all the information on the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations ahead of the 35th edition of the continent's biggest sporting event.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why is there only one Premier League game on Sunday?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why there is just one Premier League match on Sunday this weekend

item.title: Why have footballers started their own YouTube channels?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why football players have started their own YouTube channels.

item.title: Why are the queues to enter Anfield growing?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why Liverpool fans have been asked to arrive at Anfield 10 minutes earlier than usual.

item.title: Why Newcastle and Sunderland don't have away fans pitchside
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Premier League sides Newcastle and Sunderland are permitted to place away fans away from pitchside.

item.title: Which Premier League teams will lose most players to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport has a look at which Premier League clubs will be most - and least - affected by the Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: 'Celtic back Nancy as Rodgers eyes McGregor' - gossip
item.description: Former Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers reportedly wants current captain Callum McGregor at Al Qadsiah, while the Scottish champions are standing by crisis-hit new boss Wilfried Nancy.

item.title: Scotland's Burke scores stunner as Union beat RB Leipzig
item.description: Oliver Burke scores the opener as Union Berlin get the better of second-placed RB Leipzig with a surprise 3-1 victory in the Bundesliga.

item.title: Vardy is first English Serie A player of the month
item.description: Cremonese striker Jamie Vardy is the Serie A player of the month for November, becoming the first English player to win the award.

item.title: Barcelona 'not a pressure' for on-loan Rashford
item.description: Marcus Rashford says he finds nothing at Barcelona "a pressure" and is at the club to "enjoy myself" as he continues to thrive since his move from Manchester United.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
